gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: AnalogXADC.
Explanation: This module is using the XADC wizard in Xilinx FPGA to read analog voltage values from the auxp3/vauxn3 inputs and convert it into digital values. The module waits for the ready signal before saving the 11 MSB (Most Significant Bits) of the Data output of the XADC to aux_data. Additionally, it outputs a CLK_AUDIO signal, which is synchronous with the ready signal from the XADC module. The address input of the XADC is initialized to 'h13, setting the XADC channel to aux channel 3. The analog input channels to be read from are vauxp3 and vauxn3. The conversion operation is initiated and controlled by a 100MHz clock signal CLK100MHZ.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:

1. vauxp3: This is the positive input for auxilliary channel 3 which is part of the differential input pair to the XADC. The analog signal to be converted to digital is connected here.

2. vauxn3: This is the negative input for auxilliary channel 3, counterpart to vauxp3. A reciprocal of the signal applied to vauxp3 is connected here to form the differential pair.

3. CLK100MHZ: This is the input clock signal that drives the XADC, operating at a frequency of 100 MHz. This clock signal determines the rate at which the XADC completes an analog to digital conversion.

Explanation: These inputs provide the control signal (CLK100MHZ) and the data (vauxp3 & vauxn3) to the module that it uses to perform the analog-to-digital conversion process.

Output ports:

1. aux_data: This is the digital representation of the analog input signal that has been read and converted by the XADC. It is a vector of 11 bits.

2. CLK_AUDIO: This is a clock output that is synchronous with the XADC's ready signal, indicating when the converted data is available to be read.

Explanation: These outputs provide the digital representation of the analog input signal (aux_data), and a signal (CLK_AUDIO) that indicates when the digital data is ready to be read from aux_data.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals: 

1. enable
2. ready
3. data_o
4. Address_in

Explanation:

1. enable: This is an internal wire signal used by the xadc_wiz_0 block to control the data conversion process. When 'enable' is high, the XADC will start converting an analog input to its digital representation.

2. ready: This is an internal wire signal generated by the xadc_wiz_0 instance to indicate when the analog-to-digital conversion has completed. This signal is used to trigger the storing of output data in aux_data and the output of the CLK_AUDIO signal.

3. data_o: This is an internal 16 bits wide wire signal that contains the digital data output by the XADC after conversion. The 11 Most Significant Bits of data_o are stored in aux_data every time the ready signal is high.

4. Address_in: This is an internal 7 bits wide register used as the input address for the xadc_wiz_0 instance. In this implementation, 'Address_in' is initialized to 7'h13, which sets the XADC to sample from AUX Channel 3. Notably, changing the value of 'Address_in' alters which analog input channel data is sampled from.
  
The roles of these signals allows the module to control and track the progress of the analog-to-digital conversion process within the XADC, storing converted data and indicating when that data is ready to be read.
